intro: Perdicium divaricatum, commonly known as the forked spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its branching stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive lobed shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
